lexUnit.name: infer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deduce from evidence and reasoning rather than from explicit statements.

sentence.text: A more general proposal is that the court should infer guilt from a person 's refusal to answer polite questions about what happened , or their decision not to testify .
We can not directly infer a causal effect from a statistical effect .
There is empirical evidence , too , against inferring acquired competence from relative accuracy of performance .
However , let us not -- or not yet -- infer mass nationalism from separatist movements in all cases .
You can infer an attitude only from the behaviour you see .
It was perfectly proper to infer prejudice from the mere passage of time : in Cherry 's case the magistrate 's decision was based on two flawed findings of justification and no prejudice .
If we succeed then we try to infer the behaviour of the whole from the known behaviour of the parts .
Pupils can be encouraged to use a picture as evidence and to deduce and infer further things from what they see .
That Eliot tended to be curious in such matters , others have noted , and they have sometimes inferred some oddity in his own make-up .

Indeed , in some situations , the child may have to exploit this interdependence to infer the reason on the basis of information about the result , while continuing to maintain the reason/result distinction .
We can look at the way other creatures behave and from our observations infer the senses to which they are responding , but our inferences may be misleading us .
What kind of rules enable people to infer the function of what is said from its literal , formal meaning ?
We might infer , however , that Audrey 's ` big-eyed " response to the birth of a baby implies the inclusion of motherhood in her long-term plans .
In the actual examination all the figures are provided and it is only necessary to infer from inspecting the graph or drawing which of four alternatives is the correct one .
First , the agreement that risk should pass independently from property was not express but inferred by the court from the circumstances of the case .
What , thus , may we infer exactly from Johnson 's remark that he would go two miles out of his way to meet Monboddo ?
As you may infer from my name and address , I am a person of Irish origin who is currently living and working in France .
Furthermore , as when we infer from observed sweat the existence of pores in the skin , reason can lead us from what can be perceived to what can not .
Note that the court could infer the accused had been in a public place where no such direct evidence exists .
We can plausibly infer that crime has been increasing in the last two to three decades , presenting a problem for explanation and policy .

It is clear that nothing can be reliably inferred from the mere fact that a word form has different meaning relations in different contexts , and independent evidence concerning ambiguity or generality is required .
The existence of metal vases and bowls can be inferred from pottery objects which imitate metal models , sometimes even to the extent of having fake rivets and fake chain-links added .
Hemisphere dominance for speech can be inferred from either the presence or absence of aphasia following a unilateral cerebral lesion .
His date of birth has to be inferred from the preface to the third ( 1709 ) edition of his Compleat Course of Chymistry , in which he says that he was then seventy-eight .
Little is known about his family , and his date of birth can be inferred only from the fact that he was apprenticed to a mercer in 1528 .
It should be a condition , for anyone thinking about development to resist trying to infer how a structure develops by only looking at the final result .
However , once granted that one can not infer what to do from fact alone , there seems to be no flaw in the argument .
It is not difficult to infer where the information on curvature must come from .
The researchers concluded that ` one may infer that many felt there had been a conflict between studying for interest 's sake and studying for examination success " .
For if one supposes that all good things become valueless if you remove the pleasure , one may infer that all the value must lie in the pleasure .
On the material before me I think I should infer that the district judge attached at least some weight to the debtor 's arguments based on section 69 .
It is , of course , possible to infer some aspects of bureaucracy in capitalist society from the functions assigned to the state .
Yet since you ` have " your body and I ` have " mine we can infer the general features of each other 's minds by observing each other 's bodily behaviour .

Moreover , most galaxies are found in clusters , and we can similarly infer the presence of yet more dark matter in between the galaxies in these clusters by its effect on the motion of the galaxies .
